project.teaser: The current state of the art is that the project EURAKNOS has analyzed the knowledge of 28 Horizon funded Thematic Networks (TNs) and linked operational groups (OGs) and developed a vision and guidelines for a digital knowledge reservoir for an EU-wide agriculture and forestry...
project.objective: The current state of the art is that the project EURAKNOS has analyzed the knowledge of 28 Horizon funded Thematic Networks (TNs) and linked operational groups (OGs) and developed a vision and guidelines for a digital knowledge reservoir for an EU-wide agriculture and forestry practice. EUREKA has continued this effort by examining 120 Horizon funded MA projects within the EIP-AGRI and developing a ‘proof of concept’ of such a knowledge reservoir building on the results of the EURAKNOS project. EU-FarmBook will capitalize on the results of EURAKNOS and EUREKA, making the data taken up in the platform more FAIR and adding necessary functionalities to the platform based on the users’ needs such as interactive peer to peer interaction and user content evaluation tools. Moreover EU-FarmBook will assure the linkage to traditional dissemination channels, such as agricultural journals, on farm demo activities, and training and education initiatives. The EU-FarmBook will therefore work closely with associations of journalists (ENAJ), educational and training institutions and strengthen the ties with EIP-AGRI Service Point. The effort will also be expanded by looking beyond H2020 and Horizon Europe funded projects, and OGs, through linkage and interoperability with national and regional initiatives. During the whole project an intensive dialogue will be maintained with AKIS coordination offices and CAP networks in all MS. The aim is that during the first stage of the project the concept of the platform will evolve to an exploitable product that will stimulate the exchange and collaboration between the AKIS actors at an EU wide scale. Targeted and efficient management of data and information to support agriculture and forestry practice from different sources will not only support the CAP but also the Green Deal and Farm to Fork objectives and targets, ultimately resulting in innovation for an environmentally, socially and economically sustainable agriculture and forestry
project.title: EU-FarmBook: supporting knowledge exchange between all AKIS actors in the European Union

article.title: An EU-wide exchange platform for sustainable agriculture and forestry

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

article.title: Open-source, interactive database for farmers and foresters goes online
article.teaser: A newly launched online platform for agricultural knowledge invites contributions to further Europe’s transition to sustainable farming and forestry.

article.title: Why environmentally harmful farming practices are changing so slowly
Farming practices good for the environment and the farmer’s pocket
Painting a clearer picture of eco-schemes in European agriculture
Fostering co-innovation in the agricultural sector and beyond
Pointing the way to greater biodiversity

result.title: Platform requirements and design v1
result.description: Initial report on the functional and non-functional requirements of the back-end, infrastructure, and front-end. Initial documentation of the system architecture and design specifications. Initial reporting on security issues and platform deployment. (T1.1)

result.title: System infrastructure and API v1
result.description: This deliverable reports on the system infrastructure and Application Programming Interface (API). (T1.3)

result.title: EU-FarmBook Ambassadors Toolkit
result.description: In order to develop the skills and capacities of EU-FarmBook Ambassadors, a facilitation Toolkit will be provided, which will include templates, guidelines and relevant methodologies (T3.2)

result.title: Report of the kick-off meeting
result.description: Report of the kick-off meeting (T6.1).The consortium is considering a small online kick-off in September 2022, followed by a physical encounter of the consortium members in October 2022. After this, a larger meeting will be organized, to which all stakeholders will be invited (target +/- 100 attendees).

result.title: Multilingual functionalities v1
result.description: This deliverable reports on the progress for the multilinguality of the user interfaces, the provision of multilingual search capabilities, and the on-the-fly automated translation of knowledge object content. (T2.4)

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EU-FarmBook (EU-FarmBook: supporting knowledge exchange between all AKIS actors in the European Union)
result.teaser: An online, open-source, European knowledge reservoir about agriculture and forestry practical solutions was developed by two EU projects EURAKNOS and EUREKA. This new digital platform, called EU-FarmBook, makes it easy to search for and share practical knowledge about farming...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data Ingestion Pipeline and upload Interface v1
result.description: ETL tools for automating the ingestion of data and knowledge objects involving a) a data pipeline for automated batch ingestion of heterogeneous data sources ; b) an improved upload interface for uploading new knowledge objects. (T1.2)

result.title: Search and recommender system v1
result.description: This deliverable reports on progress for the search and recommender system. (T2.3)

result.title: Data standards and knowledge graph v1
result.description: This deliverable reports on the ontology, the knowledge graph and graph DB. (T1.2 + T1.5)

result.title: The effect of preference elicitation methods on the user experience in conversational recommender systems

details.authors: Liv Ziegfeld, Daan Di Scala, Anita H.M. Cremers

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
